This serum is reasonably priced and as good as any other hyaluronic/vitamin C that I've used.<br /><br />Based on the reviews I've read it seems the product is most effective/agreeable for young(ish) women (30s) who are familiar with mass market anti-aging skincare products. I am 37 years old and have always been good to my skin. I have sensitive skin (eczema) that cannot tolerate heavy duty AHAs and BHAs.<br /><br />I find the claims of the product to be true. A little goes a long way, but I know that I use more than is necessary. My skin was already oily to begin with. Using this product seemed to make me oilier, but thatbis fine with me. As I age, my skin will be glad for all the excess oil.<br /><br />I find the aloe vera calms my sensitive skin and the product does seem to attract moisture. The combination of hyaluronic acid and vitamin C in the product are kind of like buy one, get one free. I use a retinol cream on top of it and it all works well for me. You can also layer another serum over it before you moisturize.<br /><br />I'm really pleased with the outcome considering that I stumbled upon the product and bought it on a whim (because it was affordable). I will buy it again.

This one is thick and almost gel like so I can get the right amount out without wasting it and it does go on really nice and feels smooth too. It came in a nice box too.

  289. This hyaluronic acid serum is a translucent milky gel with a distinct vegetal odor dominated by the sharpness of witch hazel.<br /><br />It is very soothing when applied to the skin, especially on irritated, flakey, or slightly sunburned areas.<br /><br />The formula contains over a dozen beneficial botanical ingredients such as aloe, hyaluronic acid and glycerin that provide an intense moisturizing effect and improve the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles with regular use over time. The plant-derived hyaluronic acid may even help repair and replace damaged protein structures in the skin.<br /><br />The clear glass bottle has a dropper cap, which is very convenient. A little bit goes a long way. Apply after bathing or washing the face.<br /><br />Oz Naturals provided serum for evaluation and review.<br /><br />Ingredients (98% natural and 72% organic): Organic aloe, botanical hyaluronic acid, witch hazel, kosher vegetable glycerin, MSM, hydroxyethyl cellulose, carrageenan gum, organic jojoba oil, wildcrafted green tea, geranium essential oil, vitamin C, vitamin E, sodium benzoate, potassium sorbate, ethyl hexyl glycerin.

  293. I bought this after having good success with another 100% Hyaluronic Acid available on Amazon. Perhaps I failed on my end as a consumer to diligently sift through the product description. However, at a glance, this product appears to be marketed as a pure Hyaluronic Acid-- which it is not. Getting that out of the way, I'm still less than thrilled by this product.<br /><br />1) It sits heavy on the skin. Whereas the pure Hyaluronic Acid absorbs into the skin feeling light, this product sits on top the skin and never fully absorbs. By the end of the day my face felt oily.<br /><br />2) In addition to the unspecific ratio of HA, this product also contains several oils like Jojoba and Geranium Oil, as well as Witch Hazel, MSM, and Aloe.<br /><br />In sum, I think the product is OK-- a little on the oily side especially when compares to the other pure HA sources available for less on Amazon. What I was really put off by, was the misleading (in my opinion) and inadequate description of this product not clearly stating it to be a blend rather than Pure HA. I would not buy this again. It's not HA and it's on the low end of moisturizers.

  535. The inclusion of carrageenan in their laundry list of ingredients is a deal breaker. Research has shown that exposure to carrageenan causes inflammation and contributes to tumor growth. Since the skin is the largest organ of the body, this should be a serious concern. Use this product every day and your body is absorbing carrageenan on a daily basis. If you already have inflammation in your body this will do nothing less than contribute to it. This company raves about their organic ingredients and yet they add carrageenan as a thickener because it's cheap. They denigrate their competition and yet none of the other hyaluronic serums sold on Amazon contain carrageenan. Check it out for yourself and then Google the dangers of carrageenan. Do the research and don't get hosed by the hyper sales pitch!

  559. I bought this brand because it costs less than the others. Note that the info doesn't state the percentage of Hyaluronic Acid in this gel, which I failed to notice. That's because it seems to be watered down. HA is listed third on the ingredients, meaning HA is not the main ingredient. Aloe vera is. It's a nice little ditty of a gel that is soothing to the skin and I guess has some health and/or moisturizing benefits, but I'm returning to the brand I had before this that clearly states on the bottle 65% HA and clearly has a tightening effect on the skin (the purpose of HA). I bought this brand because it's less expensive than others, but there's a reason for that. Aloe vera, the main ingredient, is pretty cheap. Shame on OZ Naturals for misleading the public by saying it's 100% pure HA and that it's \\"natural.\\" \\"Natural\\" has no meaning in skin products. 100% pure HA doesn't mean it has 100% HA...it just means the form of HA it uses is \\"pure,\\" which I'm not sure what they mean by that. Organic, maybe? I've used it a week and see no difference in my skin, as opposed to my prior brand, where I could tell a difference in skin firmness almost immediately. I'll give this more time and use it up, since I've paid for it. I should add that if you are not that old but just want a little lift, this may work fine for you. But I'm getting older and need the strong stuff!<br /><br />UPDATE 1/4/2015: I ran across this product again when searching for something else. I notice that they changed their main description at the top. While it used to say the product was 100% Hyaluronic Acid (which was misleading since it gave the impression the liquid gel contains only HA), it has now removed that description at the top and added further down the page that the gel is \\"with 100% HA,\\" which is more accurate. They've also added to the main description at the top of the page that it contains other substances, like Vitamins C&E, which makes it clear that the liquid is not 100% HA.

  583. Let me make it clear that I have not bought this product and therefore have no idea or care whether this stuff works. By scam, I mean that all of these raving reviews are a bit sketchy if you ask me.<br /><br />Moving on to the most relevant thing I wanted to point out. This product reeked of being a scam upon reading through the reviews. Not the negative reviews, which already made me question the product, but the responses to the negative reviews by some Craig guy who says he is the cofounder. His responses were so ridiculous, I was enjoying reading them. Highly entertaining stuff! Here are a few that I found particularly immature and hilarious.<br /><br />One reviewer says:<br /><br />&#34;Like many Amazon customers I check out the reviews written by the customers who have tried a product to see what they say. As I read the reviews written on this product I found it disturbing to see so many that were written by “unverified purchases”. I noticed few from yesterday and quite a few from the March 4th. I want to read feedback from someone who has tried the product, not an unverified source. I feel like I’m being tricked..&#34;<br /><br />Craig, whose name on Amazon is CR, says this in response:<br /><br />&#34;Hey james, all of our reviews come from real users of our products and 99% of them I see are from verified purchases. Our products are also sold at spas and retail stores. We also give out our products in gift bags and other promotional events. These customers of course will not show as verified purchases.<br /><br />Not only do we take great offense to your completely false and inaccurate assumption, but I'm sure all the customers who've taken the time to post their reviews take offense too. It's not fair for you to simply assume our reviews are fake simple because some of the customers didn't buy our product on Amazon. You're essentially calling our customers liars...<br /><br />I would highly request you revise your completely false accusation....By the way, your &#34;Review&#34; which really isn't a review...is also NOT an Amazon Verified Purchase. Your comment does absolutely nothing to help the Amazon community. In fact we have reason to believe that you're simply an angry competitor attempting to compete with OZ Naturals...Well, Good luck...you'll need a lot more than posting negative accusations. OZ Naturals clearly provides the highest quality, best selling anti aging serums on Amazon and your comment here will do nothing to slow the growth of this company AND your review will soon be buried by real reviews left by real customers who benefit from our products. Essentially, it was a waste of your time.&#34;<br /><br />At one point, he says this:<br /><br />&#34;What do you mean how's the serum working for me? I'm actually the co-founder of the company so I get paid A LOT and because the brand is so successful I'm actually able to spend my time answering questions and comments if I choose to do so. I have that luxury :)&#34;<br /><br />I was laughing audibly at this point. Last but not least though, is a delightfully stupid reply to a bad review from a reviewer called &#34;leila&#34;:<br /><br />&#34;it's so funny how some people wait until their face all wrinkled then they start using serums and creams...and they expect the product to work for them wight away..ha ha ha...if you really care about your beauty..you should of started using anti wrinkle creams and serums when your 27 years old not when your 46....I have been using antiwrinkles creams when I was 25 now i'm 37 and every one thinks i'm just 27. by the way this serum works great and i'm just getting ready to buy another bottle&#34;<br /><br />This lovely comment is given a response by our professional acting &#34;cofounder,&#34; Craig:<br /><br />&#34;Agreed & Thank you Leila!!&#34;<br /><br />These arethe most immature comments I have ever heard coming from a business person!   774. I'm about 10 days into using this...did not start using it right away. So far, I'm pleased. I am almost 71, dry skin, some wrinkles on cheeks, due mainly to youthful scarring from acne that, in my late 60s, wrinkles settled into the little pocket scars. I do believe that some of my finer lines are diminished and that this product is beginning to lessen the wrinkles on my cheeks. My 'jowls' either side of my mouth and chin have slightly (just slightly) improved...I'm hoping for more improvement.<br /><br />This product sort of stings at first, but not very much...no discomfort at all. A little goes a long way....just a light slick rubbed in is all that is needed, NOT a whole dropper full of product. Avoid eyes, and right away, I apply moisturizer cream. I am using only at night...so perhaps I now need to increase to morning and night and I'll see faster improvement. One improvement I definitely notice is that little, hard white bumps...a bit like a pimple but really a white head deposit that I sometimes get either side of my nose down to almost my lips...these tiny pin-head size white bumps are going away. It has to be this product. In the past, I've had a dermatologist remove an annoying spot or two, or after months, sometimes the deposit will rub off. They form where in my youth I was very oily.<br /><br />I WILL continue to use this product, no matter what other products for moisturizing that I choose to use.
  775. First let me stipulate that I am an Oz Naturals skin-care consumer and not only have tried almost every product in the line, I use most of their products every day and some of them both in the morning and in the evening as part of my nightly skin-care routine.<br /><br />The first two products that initiated my appreciation of the Oz Naturals line is their Vitamin C 20% Amino Blend Hyaluronic Acid Serum, with the yellow square on the bottle and the second product is the Hyaluronic Acid Vitamin C, with a green square on the bottle.<br /><br />I have reached my sixties, and for the past, few months have started a rigorous and aggressive nightly procedure of derma rolling. When I have finished with this procedure, my face is red, raw and my skin is extremely sensitive. First, I apply the Oz Naturals Vitamin C Serum and it does NOT sting. This was the only Vitamin C serum that had not irritated my face after this procedure, most likely because the others used alcohol content, whereas Oz Naturals uses Witch Hazel, which is not irritating on my skin. After I have let the serum absorb for a moment or two and I feel the effect of a slight tightening, I then apply the Hyaluronic Acid. The Hyaluronic Acid is a little thicker than the serum and it actually feels somewhat soothing to my raw skin. Again, no sting at all. I wait a moment or two for the Hyaluronic Acid to be completely absorbed and I can actually notice that the dry, raw skin is a little less red, and just a little plumped out. Then I proceed to my nightly moisturizer.<br /><br />It is in the morning that I get the pleasant surprise. Overnight, my face has completely healed and the skin looks a little plumper and healthier. I was not getting the same positive results before I started using Oz Naturals. The morning results are definitely visible and I am positively thrilled that there is no irritation considering the abusive and aggressive nature that I am enduring with the derma rolling five nights a week.<br /><br />I recommend both of these Oz Natural products, as a regular maintenance, for those who have sensitive skin issues, and for those of us who are going through any skin care treatments. These products are gentle to the skin, and give positive results.<br /><br />This ends my review of Oz Natural products - Hyaluronic Acid, however, for those who are just starting to learn about skin care maintenance, I have provided a brief synopsis of the benefits, functions, and the results of Hyaluronic Acid in general.<br /><br />The Benefits of Hyaluronic Acid for Skin<br /><br />Hyaluronic acid is an important natural component of skin produced by fibroblast skin cells, which decreases as we age. Skin starts losing hyaluronic acid as early as age 18, but wrinkles and other skin damage from hyaluronic acid loss generally do not show up until we are in our late 30s or early 40s.<br /><br />Hyaluronic acid, also known as HA, is a natural compound found in skin that has many important functions; including holding in moisture, providing cushioning, aiding in tissue repair, holding together the skin structural components collagen and elastin, and helping create a protective barrier against microorganisms. The topical HA product is considered effective at moisturizing surface skin cells, which prevents water loss and protects the skin from dirt and other pollutants.<br /><br />Moisturizing - Since hyaluronic acid holds moisture well--holding up to 1,000 times its weight in water--it functions not only to deliver water to the skin, but also to hold it there. As a large molecule, it does not permeate deep into the skin, but instead stays near the surface where it moisturizes the skin's outer surface layers.<br /><br />Wrinkles - The loss of natural hyaluronic acid is one of the causes of wrinkles, so the idea of putting HA back into the skin to repair wrinkles makes sense. Since topical HA cannot penetrate to deeper layers, the moisturizing effects will only last a fewdays. Repeated use will maintain moisture levels in the skin, preventing skin dehydration. Hyaluronic acid is useful for reducing or removing wrinkles. By reducing wrinkles, hyaluronic acid does help to produce healthier skin, restoring skin tone, for a smooth and supple young and healthier look.<br /><br />I really hope that this review and/or the general information has been informative, because skin care can be a little confusing in the functions of each product, so hopefully this has been helpful.<br /><br />UPDATE; 6/06/14 HELPFUL TIP<br />I live in the desert, the climate is so dry with almost no humidity. Keeping moisturized is a challenge here and we know that dry skin is very prone to wrinkles. Anyway, I recently purchased a humidifier for my bedroom, which is where I spend 8-10 hours from evening to morning. It has made a substantial difference in my skin, in the range of about 15% - 20%, a little different each day. So, if you reside in a relatively dry and low humidity area, try using a humidifier, the benefits of skin care products are improved.days. Repeated use will maintain moisture levels in the skin, preventing skin dehydration. Hyaluronic acid is useful for reducing or removing wrinkles. By reducing wrinkles, hyaluronic acid does help to produce healthier skin, restoring skin tone, for a smooth and supple young and healthier look.<br /><br />I really hope that this review and/or the general information has been informative, because skin care can be a little confusing in the functions of each product, so hopefully this has been helpful.<br /><br />UPDATE; 6/06/14 HELPFUL TIP<br />I live in the desert, the climate is so dry with almost no humidity. Keeping moisturized is a challenge here and we know that dry skin is very prone to wrinkles. Anyway, I recently purchased a humidifier for my bedroom, which is where I spend 8-10 hours from evening to morning. It has made a substantial difference in my skin, in the range of about 15% - 20%, a little different each day. So, if you reside in a relatively dry and low humidity area, try using a humidifier, the benefits of skin care products are improved.

I already have the Oz Vitamin C serum and the Oz eye gel, so I wanted to be able to test this on it's own to see how it would work. I have scar tissue on my ankles and the sides of my feet that bother be because they pull when I walk and can sometimes make it painful to walk long distances. I started using this Hyaluronic Acid + Vitamin C Moisturizing Serum on my scars, and then following it up with a good moisturizer. In the past, just using a moisturizer has done NOTHING for my scars. After a week of using the combination of this serum and a moisturizer, my scar tissue has softened to the point where I can walk without pain. The scar tissue isn't gone, but it's been softened enough that the ridges aren't as prominent and it's not pulling on the rest of my skin.<br /><br />I know this is supposed to be used on your face, but there is already proof in the other reviews that it does work. I wanted to know that it would actually work to moisturize something that seemed impossible. I use this serum in the morning and in the evening, and follow it up with a good moisturizer after it dries. The scar tissue is now soft and flexible enough to stretch, which is pretty much a miracle and a true test of this serum's quality.

It's still sitting in my cabinet I cannot use, waste of money, but not the company's fault. Sometimes products just don't agree with some people, everyone's skin is different.<br /><br />So now this past July I had ran out of my hyaluronic serum and came here to repurchase another bottle. Matter.<br /><br />Within the next couple days my skin broke out and I knew it was the stupid Vit C added because I made sure to keep my regime the same.<br /><br />OZ Naturals you have lost a loyal customer for good unless you go back to the old formula. I had a Holy Grail product and it got ripped from my Cabinet of Divine products. What a shame.<br /><br />So for those of you who are sensitive to topical Vitamin C, head back to the search results page and look at other products. It has ingredients in it besides hyaluronic acid--it also contains vitamin C, which is a great antioxidant. The combination of the hyaluronic acid and the vitamin C acts as a carrier for your regular moisturizer--it is an extra step to add into your routine. I wash my face with Biore Ice Cleanser, then use a homemade toner made from witch hazel and essential oils (peppermint, tea tree, lemongrass, and eucalyptus). All those menthol ingredients stimulate circulation in the face. Once my toner is dry, I apply a drop of this serum, about the size of a Sixlet, all over my face, concentrating on the corners of my eyes to the temple where I have been seeing lines and underneath my eyes, as well as my forehead. Once that absorbs, I follow that with my daytime or nighttime moisturizer, whatever time of day it is (I do this twice a day). I feel like I have finally found the perfect facial care routine for my skin.

  1096. This is a pretty powerful serum because it will start showing you some results almost immediately with continued use. It also has Vitamin C in this serum so if you are using a Vitamin C Serum, I wouldn't use it while using this Hyaluronic Acid Serum because it might be too much for your face.<br /><br />This serum is not like the others I have tried in that it's not clear and it's thicker than most serums as you can see by the above picture. It went on smoothly and absorbed rather quickly, which is a good thing, because I have dry skin and because I don't like for serums to sit on top of my skin and make it look greasy.<br /><br />You don't need much as this serum will go a long way, so be careful about how much you apply. I would hate for you to waste this precious serum. And please be aware, that this is really awesome for fine lines and wrinkles, but with deep wrinkles, while it may soften them and make them less noticeable, it will not get rid of them permanently. I haven't found a serum or cream that has ever done that and don't expect to. That kind of deep wrinkle will have to have professional help and I won't lie and tell you that there is a magic cream or serum out there.<br /><br />But, if you use this serum the right way and take care of your skin, like using sunscreen protection and moisturizers, you can make a difference in your skin, especially if you start young. Trying to change 50 and 60 year old skin will be harder but you can improve it. Just be realistic in what topical serums and creams can do and you won't be disappointed because there really are some great serums and creams out there, like this one, that can give your skin a much better look.

  1195. Though the use of Hyaluronic acid serum is well establishes as a quality and reliable topical skin toner and refresher, few can attest to it virtues better than those with dry, sun damaged skin. Where cream and moisturizers feel refreshing when applied, this 5% hyaluronic acid serum with vitamins C and E (both established as necessary for skin health) actually penetrates the epidermis and balances the skin's natural water loss. As a result the skin remains hydrated and that in turn diminishes fine wrinkles and line associated with dry, damaged (even if just by age!) facial skin. If it doesn't make you look decades younger then your expectations are too high. Use as directed (VERY important) and the results are noticeable within a few days and after a month your skin will indeed look more refreshed!   1274. I have been using this product (provided to me for review) for a couple of weeks. Do I see miraculous changes? No. Did I expect to see such? No.<br /><br />My approach to skincare is rather scattershot, perhaps because there is no solid science here, only marketing claims; I'm not willing to spend hundreds of dollars on fanciful advertising, nor am I willing to experiment with potentially toxic chemicals. So, I aim for products that<br /><br />1. Don't contain chemicals considered hazardous or unhealthful on the Environmental Working Group's Skin Deep database (Yes, I know it's not the last word on certain ingredients, but for now it's the best I have)<br />2. Do contain ingredients that make some bit of scientific sense (such as Vitamin C, Vitamin E, hyaluronic acid, etc.)<br />3. Feel good on the skin<br />4. Have no annoying odors<br />5. Are easy to apply<br />6. Are efficiently designed, so as not to take up inordinate space in my medicine chest<br />7. At least fool me into seeing some benefit on my inevitably aging skin<br /><br />I recently received three OZ Naturals products for trial, and I'm pretty happy with all three, based on the criteria above: this Vitamin C serum, the Super Youth Eye Gel, and the Hyaluronic acid.<br /><br />Of the three, the eye gel might my least favorite, but only because I prefer a rich emollient eye cream; this gel dries quickly and feels dry. Maybe it's doing what it's supposed to, but for those who are looking for more moisture, this might not fit the bill. To hedge my bets, I apply it, let it dry, and then apply a moisturizer.<br /><br />Regarding the four-star rating, I give most &#34;skin-care&#34; product four stars simply because it's difficult to know if it's actually &#34;working.&#34; I did not knock off a star due to any features of the product.

  1326. I have been using this product for about 5 months now. I am a 41 years old, very fair complexion (I burn easy), and prone to sunspots and dark patches. I started using this product to stop the age/sun spots from getting darker while I saved up for a Laser treatment. The age spots were still there, but my overall complexion was restored to a natural glow.<br /><br />The second thing I noticed was this product is NOT a moisturizer. It does leave my skin feeling a little dry and itchy if I wear it alone (on weekends). You have to follow up with your regular moisturizer or this will feel uncomfortable if you are prone to dry skin. It wears well under makeup and doesn't seem to interfere with my other morning products at all. I put this on my clean face, let it dry, then my Primer, then my foundation mixed with my face moisturizer. Works like a charm.<br /><br />Once I was in my routine I forgot about it and went on with my life. About 2 - 3 months later as I was getting ready to put my makeup on and noticed that the sunspot on my face was gone. Not diminished. Not lighter. Gone! (That never happens!). lol.<br /><br />I can't say I see a huge improvement in my fine lines and wrinkles, but that could just be because I wasn't paying attention.   1389. This is a great product. It comes highly recommended. But don't be misled by the 100% pure Hyaluronic acid. What they mean is 100% of a 1% solution. Pure 100% Hyaluronic acid is a powder. It would take tons of liquid to dissolve into a serum. Even 25% Hyaluronic acid would be a thick paste, and it would be horribly destructive to your skin. A 1% solution is the standard amount used by practically all manufacturers. It is proven to give the best results. The other 99% of the serum is made up of other ingredients that vary by manufacturer (vitamin C, E, aloe vera, emolients, etc,) As long as you can trust that it is a 1% solution (best to choose the vegan/vegetarian type, the non vegan/vegetarian type is made out of the roosters' combs, among other things), they're all pretty much the same. Don't be misled by all the hype and the price. Also, most people don't know that Hyaluroic Acid can be taken internally (as capsules or as a powder, a very small amount dissolved into your favorite beverage). Internally, it is used to improve the appearance of your skin and, especially, to improve joint health. In your joints it pulls moisture into the joints, which has a lubricating effect. (Search for Hyaluronic capsules or Hyaluronic powder here on Amazon). You can even make your own serum from the powder, it comes with the instructions on how to do this. This is what I do, because it is much, much cheaper. You can even create your own Hyaluronic Acid at home if you're so inclined. Check out how to do this on YouTube)

Regular exercise maintains healthy circulation and blood flow throughout your body, including your skin. If you're exercising outdoors, though, remember to wear a sunscreen on your face that protects against UVA and UVB rays or use a moisturizer with sunscreen protection.<br />3.Quit smoking. Studies find that smoking prematurely ages skin by disrupting your body's natural process of breaking down old skin and replacing it with fresh skin. Smoking also triples your risk of squamous cell skin cancer (not to mention numerous other cancers).<br />4.Manage stress. Stress can negatively affect your face (and the rest of the body). Incorporate stress-relief techniques into your daily schedule; perhaps try meditation or yoga or even just a relaxing bath atthe end of the day.<br />5.Create a good skin care regimen. This one may seem more obvious, but don’t overlook the importance of daily cleaning and moisturizing. Use a gentle cleanser and find a moisturizer that suits your skin needs.<br /><br />Hope this all helps

The general idea is that hyaluronic acid pulls moisture into your skin and keeps it there; in itself, it does not moisturize. So I don't know how well it would work if used in any other way, but it definitely helps my skin utilize my moisturizer and the difference is immediately visible.

I would never pay the full price they have discounted. EVER. But I would keep buying for twenty bucks or so, since it goes pretty fast using it twice per day.   1880. 5% Hyaluronic Acid Serum -Another fabulous beauty find, OZ’s Hyaluronic Serum acts to plump up and hydrate your skin while stimulating collagen in order to reduce the appearance of fine lines. Again, something I need in abundance. First you put on the serum and allow it to dry before putting your moisturizer on top of it. This serum smells amazing because it’s scented with geranium essential oil. It also has a distinctly aloe-y consistency when spread on the face; very light and yet slightly viscous or sticky. That sticky sensation dissipates after a minute or two of drying. The serum is a lovely consistency; liquidity enough that it's easy to apply and move around your face but gel enough that it doesn't run all over the place before you've had a chance to apply it. It has a very slight scent, but it's really pleasant; I detect rose which is a smell I'm always happy to have in my beauty products but I know there are just as many people who hate the smell as there are that love it. You have to work with it very quickly because as soon as it comes into contact with your skin it sinks in, something that I love about it, it makes my skin care routine very fast. Firstly I cleanse and tone my face as usual, then I apply the serum. As soon as it's been applied there is no residue on the skin at all, within a couple of seconds it's completely disappeared and you're ready for your moisturiser. I use this all over my face, even up to my lash line on my eyes, and it doesn't sting or affect my sensitive eyes in any way, it even helps my eye cream to not effect them, something I really wasn't expecting. There isn't one point there that I can disagree with. Now about the serum: in the past I have used products containing hyaluronic acid, but apart from how much active ingredient is actually in the bottle, it seems that the synergy with other components is crucial. This serum is packaged in a glass bottle with a dropper to facilitate precise application. The contents are 1 fluid ounce or 30 ml, which is pretty standard, but you need very little to cover your whole face and neck, making this product really good value for money. It looks like it can easily last a couple of months. With gentle massage, the almost clear gel sinks in easily and dries quickly. You then apply your favourite cream or oil on top, which now has a much better chance to penetrate and actually do some of the wonderful things promised on the box. A serum is a carrier, so it is very important to choose an effective moisturiser or nourishing cream to apply afterwards.<br />I was sent a sample of OZ Natural’s Professional Moisturizing Serum for this review, no compensation was given and all opinions are my own.ounce or 30 ml, which is pretty standard, but you need very little to cover your whole face and neck, making this product really good value for money. It looks like it can easily last a couple of months. With gentle massage, the almost clear gel sinks in easily and dries quickly. You then apply your favourite cream or oil on top, which now has a much better chance to penetrate and actually do some of the wonderful things promised on the box. A serum is a carrier, so it is very important to choose an effective moisturiser or nourishing cream to apply afterwards.<br />I was sent a sample of OZ Natural’s Professional Moisturizing Serum for this review, no compensation was given and all opinions are my own.

  1914. First let me say that I received an email from this company asking if I would be willing to try three of their products and give a review. I can only vouch for my email, but there was nothing about me giving the product a good review. So I said sure. I had no idea what an explosive subject it is. I guarantee that I am a real person who won't gain a penny for my opinion, nor would I want to, as paying for a good review is no different than stuffing a ballot box. So here goes...<br /><br />- I used this product in the evening after washing my face.<br />- The serum is very light, almost like water and went right into my skin without leaving it sticky (which I dislike).<br />- This is company's serums are the first I've tried that didn't make my skin break out.<br />- A little bit goes a long way, which I appreciate.<br />- I have noticed a difference in my skin. Most notably that it seems much firmer, and the smile lines around my eyes and dimples aren't nearly so noticeable.<br />- I do use a very light moisturiser once I've given the serum time to be completely absorbed<br /><br />Overall, these products have been a surprise. They work well for me, although everyone's skin is different and even different ages can cause uneven results. I also appreciate the lack of chemicals. The price for these products is VERY reasonable. I have used products like this that cost a fortune and didn't work nearly as well (or at all). I look at using good products as a means of holding off aging for as long as possible. Perhaps someday I will look in the mirror and decide that I want something more drastic, but I'm not there yet.

(&#34;Green Tea Classic&#34; w/ caffiene -- boil 2 bags as directed with Kentwood &#34;Spring Bottled Water&#34;, let cool-may add more spring water to make a lil less concentrated/make it last longer.   1998. I have been using the Oz Naturals products now for about six months and am very pleased with the results. I have many allergies and sensitivities and have had a lot of difficulty finding a facial care regimen that didn't cause me problems. Before discovering the Oz Naturals products, I was using a natural, olive oil based soap and moisturizer. I had not found any skin care supplements like retinol, alpha hydroxy or other acids I could safely use. I had frequent breakouts and a couple of dry, rough patches that wouldn't go away no matter what I tried. My skin was always blotchy looking, so I constantly used foundation to help cover my uneven skin tones. I started using the Oz Ocean Minerals Facial Cleanser, then added the Hyaluronic Acid Serum, the Eye Gel and the Super Youth Moisturizer. Those rough dry patches I'd had for several months completely disappeared within the first week of use and in less than two weeks, my skin tone had improved significantly and my breakouts were gone. I was amazed! Now I rarely have any breakouts, and I my skin tone is so even that I frequently go out without using foundation - something I wouldn't have dreamed of doing before. A little of this product goes a long way. I use only three drops for my face and neck combined. After almost six months of use, I still have a third of the bottle left, making this an excellent value. I would certainly recommend this product.
